definition: A solid or hollow shape with straight sides and circular ends of equal size.
examples: The candle was shaped like a cylinder.
Engine cylinders help power the car.

extra.memory_tip: Cylinder = circle at both ends with long sides.

definition: To look at something carefully in order to learn more about it.
examples: The doctor examined the patient’s knee.
Please examine the chart before answering.

definition: Causing death; very serious and causing disaster.
examples: The bite of that snake can be fatal.
A fatal error crashed the programme.

definition: An important or special part of something; to include as a special part.
examples: Water resistance is a key feature of this watch. (noun)
Next week’s show will feature young inventors. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Feature = the part you focus on.

definition: To take hold of firmly; to understand; a firm hold or understanding.
examples: She grasped the rail to keep her balance. (verb)
He has a good grasp of fractions. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Grasp = hold it in your hand or in your mind.

definition: A fast aeroplane; a stream of liquid or gas under pressure; to travel by jet or spurt out.
examples: The jet took off at dawn. (noun)
Water jetted from the broken pipe. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Jet = a fast plane or a fast stream.

definition: Related to the sea; a member of a naval infantry force.
examples: Coral reefs are rich marine habitats. (adjective)
A marine guided the visitors on base. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Marine = think ‘marine life’ in the sea.

definition: A mark left on skin or land after a cut or injury; to leave a mark or lasting hurt.
examples: He has a small scar on his chin. (noun)
The fire scarred the hillside. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Scar = a story your skin remembers.

definition: A long, flexible arm used by some sea animals to hold or feel things.
examples: The octopus wrapped a tentacle around the jar.
Jellyfish tentacles can sting.

extra.memory_tip: Tentacle = ‘tentative feeler’ to touch and grab.

definition: A ship or large boat; a container; a tube that carries blood or other fluids.
examples: The research vessel sailed at midnight.
Blood vessels carry oxygen around the body.

extra.memory_tip: Vessel = something that ‘holds’—people, goods, or fluids.
